column4: Do you know how to use dpkg to create a list of installed packages that I can move to another machine and have that machine install those same packages
dpkg -l (lists all installed packages, but there are better ways to do what you want)
eeh, i never done that, just heard... trying wiki...
yeah, something like that :)
yea, I get the list but how do I get the other system to read that list and install the packages
dpkg --get-selections < myprog.txt only sets the list.. it does not install them
you need apt-get or aptitude for that, iirc
How do I get apt to read the list, I dont want to do it manually, 100's of lines
did you search google or wiki ? im pretty sure this is done many times...
ill try to find...
I may just be phrasing the querry wrong
http://www.debian-administration.org/articles/282
seems to be "dpkg --set-selections" and then "apt-get dselect-upgrade"
you could make a bookmark to that site, has helped me alot
I marked that site, that info was close... thanks
gconf-editor
thanx
hmm, searching for "Places" in gconf-editor gave 0 results :/
Please lose the wtx shorthand.. It is not necessary
so you mean we should not be human here ? ...
Not up for discussion. Stop ...
so any emotional expression is not allowed ? WTF! since when ?
